document: <sentence id="s1" text="Chronic mucocutaneous candidiasis (CMC) occurs in patients with mutations in genes affecting positive regulation of interleukin-23 production-mediated immunity, such as li>STAT3, regulation of transcription, DNA-templated, negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II, positive regulation of stress-activated MAPK cascade, IL12B, and li>IL12RB1, or gain of function (GOF) mutations in li>STAT1.">
